Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

title: UFOs and Unusual Phenomena in NYS

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: UFOs and Unusual Phenomena in NYS
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any reports, files, or other documentation related to sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) within any parks, recreational areas, or other properties in NY State for the period of January 1, 2010 to present.

Any reports, files, or other documentation related to unusual phenomena or events that occurred within any parks, recreational areas, or other properties in NY State for the period of January 1, 2010 to present.

Please include all correspondence, memos, letters, emails, notes, audio recordings, photographs, and any other documentation related to these reports.

If any part of my request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, including a reference to the specific statutory exemption(s) upon which you rely. In addition, please provide me with the name, title, and email address of the individual responsible for the denial of any part of my request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: Energy Ant

communications.communication:
Dear U.S. Department of Energy:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED:

I am seeking records related to DOE's mascot, Energy Ant. Specifically, I request the following records:

1. Please produce all records related to the conception, creation, and design of the Energy Ant mascot. Please include any contracts or design concepts (e.g. sketches) in your production, as well as all records related to DOE's decision to create a mascot in the first place.

2. Please produce all Energy Ant-related promotional items, educational items, or tchotchkes, past or present, that took the form of records, such as trading cards, posters, or books (including but not limited to coloring books, activity books, or comic books).

3. Please produce all records related to the conception, creation, design, and use of any life-size Energy Ant costume. Responsive records would include contracts for the design or production of such a costume; design proposals or sketches; correspondence with the designer or manufacturer; and any guidelines related to the use of or care for the costume.

4. Please produce all correspondence related to Energy Ant (or to mascots in general) sent to or from any member of Congress, their office, or their staff. Oklahoma Senator Tom Coburn may have sent some responsive correspondence around 2007. Iowa Senator Jodi Ernst may also have sent responsive records.

5. Please produce all records related to any decision by DOE to stop using Energy Ant as part of its public outreach.
REQUEST FOR FEE WAIVER:

The requested documents will be made available to the general public online for free, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am working on a non-commercial project examining the history, creation, evolution, and use of mascots across the federal government—because, like many others, I find them fascinating and weirdly delightful. Thus, I respectfully request that any fees related to this request be waived. If you do decide to charge me fees, please notify me in advance if you expect those fees to exceed $25.

FORM OF PRODUCTION:

I would prefer that this request be fulfilled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or on CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION:

Thank you very much for your cooperation with this request. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Reconnecting Communities Grants
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

every grant application and accompanying material submitted to the US Department of Transportation's Reconnecting Communities program. 

In February, the Department of Transportation released a fact sheet for "Reconnecting Communities Pilot Program FY 2022" for the projects awarded this year. I would like the applications for all projects considered.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Edwin Rios

title: Rasheem Carter

communications.subject: Mississippi Public Records Act Request: Rasheem Carter
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Police reports filed to Taylorsville Police Department referring to Rasheem Carter
- Any incident reports filed to Taylorsville Police Department and Smith County Sheriff's Department referring to Rasheem Carter
- Any investigation file referring to the case of Rasheem Carter
- Any video footage the Taylorsville Police Department and Smith County Sheriff's Department has in the investigation into Rasheem Carter's death. Carter's family shared video footage of a trail camera showing Rasheem on a wooded trail near Taylorsville indicating that there is video footage. 
- Any emails to, from, and cc'ing Taylorsville Police Chief Gabe Horn that includes the keywords "Rasheem Carter" "Carter" "Rasheem" 

HuffPost reported that Smith County Sheriff's Department is overseeing the criminal investigation into Rasheem's death. Taylorsville Police Chief Gabe Horn told a local newspaper in December that Rasheem Carter filed a police report when he visited the station but declined to press any charges against whomever was threatening him. Police found Rasheem's body on November 2, 2022. https://www.natchezdemocrat.com/2022/12/07/family-seeking-answers-in-fayette-mans-death/

I'm a senior reporter for the Guardian, and the family has been outspoken about this case. The case is a matter of public interest given that the case has been unresolved at the moment, and the case is under investigation. That said, I would request a rolling release of materials if possible.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Edwin Rios

title: FBI File for the deceased political commentator Michael Jamal Brooks

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI File for the deceased political commentator Michael Jamal Brooks
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request all records concerning a deceased individual named Michael Jamal Brooks.

Mr. Brooks was known for providing commentary for for media outlets such as : The Young Turks, Jacobin, Zero Books, and his own show The Michael Brooks show.

Mr. Brooks  was born on August 13, 1983 and passed away on July 20, 2020. As proof of death, I have included a link to his Wikipedia page: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Brooks_(political_commentator)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

blake griffith

title: Water Quality Complaints in Albany, Schenectady, and Troy MSA (Bethlehem Water District No 1)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Water Quality Complaints in Albany, Schenectady, and Troy MSA (Bethlehem Water District No 1)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to and copies of records related to water quality complaints and issues within the Albany, Schenectady, and Troy Metropolitan Statistical Area (MSA) for the period from January 1, 2018, to the present.

Specifically, I am seeking the following information:

1) The total number of water quality complaints received by your agency/authority/utility, broken down by year.

2) A detailed summary of each water quality complaint, including:
2a. The date of the complaint
2b. The location (address or nearest cross streets) of the complaint
2c. The nature of the complaint (e.g., odor, taste, discoloration, contamination concerns)
2d. Any actions taken by your agency/authority/utility to address the complaint
2e. The resolution or current status of the complaint

3) Any reports, memos, or other documentation related to water quality complaints, investigations, and resolutions within the specified area and timeframe.

If any of this information is available in electronic format, I kindly request that you provide it via email. If physical copies are necessary, please inform me of any copying or postage fees in advance, and I will make arrangements for payment.

If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a detailed explanation for the denial and inform me of any appeal procedures available under New York State law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.subject: FOIL Request :: W113527-031523
communications.communication:
Dear Jackson: 
 
Thank you for your Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) request. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 3/15/2023 and given the reference number FOIL #W113527-031523 for tracking purposes. You may expect the Department's response to your request no later than 4/13/2023. 
 
Record Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to and copies of records related to water quality complaints and issues within the Albany, Schenectady, and Troy Metropolitan Statistical Area (MSA) for the period from January 1, 2018, to the present.

Specifically, I am seeking the following information:

1) The total number of water quality complaints received by your agency/authority/utility, broken down by year.

2) A detailed summary of each water quality complaint, including:
2a. The date of the complaint
2b. The location (address or nearest cross streets) of the complaint
2c. The nature of the complaint (e.g., odor, taste, discoloration, contamination concerns)
2d. Any actions taken by your agency/authority/utility to address the complaint
2e. The resolution or current status of the complaint

3) Any reports, memos, or other documentation related to water quality complaints, investigations, and resolutions within the specified area and timeframe.

If any of this information is available in electronic format, I kindly request that you provide it via email. If physical copies are necessary, please inform me of any copying or postage fees in advance, and I will make arrangements for payment.

If any portion of this request is denied, please provide a detailed explanation for the denial and inform me of any appeal procedures available under New York State law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law and the obligations of county health departments under the New York State Local Government Records Retention and Disposition Schedule (LGS-1) for birth and death records, I hereby request the following records:

Live Birth Data including constant birth rate, long term, short term, and average birth rates for within the county or school district subdivisions for the current (2022/23) and previous six years by year.

Birth to Kindergarten Survival Ratio for the county or school district subdivisions used for the past ten years by year.

All communications to or from school districts, NYS Education Department, NYS Bureau of Vital Statistics, or NYS Department of Health containing these statistical tabulations and data, and any communications regarding requests for this data, responses from the county health department to these parties regarding live birth data and/or any abnormal vital statistics observations since November 2019.

I request that the records be provided in electronic format, either by email attachment or on a CD-ROM.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. If you have any questions or concerns regarding this request, please do not hesitate to contact me. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: UIUC PD Jaywalking Citations (Champaign Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

- A list of all citations issued to pedestrians for "jaywalking," or crossing a roadway at any point other than within a marked crosswalk or within an unmarked crosswalk at an intersection (Illinois Vehicle Code, Rules of the Road, 625 ILCS 5/11-1003), between January 1, 2019 and March 14, 2023 on Green Street in Champaign, IL, between S 1st St and S Wright St, excluding any personally identifying information about subjects or offenders.
- The names and badge numbers of officers present on Green St. between S 5th St and S 6th St on March 10, 2023 between 8 and 10 p.m. Central Time
- Traffic camera footage from cameras at the intersection of Green St. and 6th St on March 10, 2023 between 8 and 10 p.m. Central Time
- Incident reports, field interview reports or other relevant documents filed by officers in the department's Records Management System (RMS) for incidents occurring on Green St. on March 10, 2023

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jake Williams

title: Snow Day, State of Emergency, Withheld Education (South Colonie Central School District)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Snow Day, State of Emergency, Withheld Education (South Colonie Central School District)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL), I am requesting the following records:

All communications, including emails, memos, and other written documents, related to the decision to cancel remote instruction on 3/14/23, specifically as it relates to the State of Emergency declared by the State of New York due to inclement weather.

Any policies, guidelines, or procedures related to the decision-making process for cancelling remote instruction during inclement weather and/or a State of Emergency.

Any documents related to funding differences between a regular school day, snow day off of school, snow day with remote instruction, and no instruction and school cancelled with a State of Emergency for the State of New York.
